lines.content: * The Command abstract class represents a user command.
* Concrete command classes extend this class to implement specific commands.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The Ui object for user interaction.
* @param storage The Storage object for saving/loading tasks.
* @throws AirBorderException If an error occurs during command execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AirBorderException;
* Indicates whether this command exits the application.
* @return true if the command exits the application; false otherwise.
* The {@code FindCommand} class represents a command to find tasks
* Constructs a {@code FindCommand} with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Executes the find command by searching for matching tasks and displaying them.
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} object for user interaction.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} object for saving/loading tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for interpreting user commands
* and returning the appropriate {@code Command} objects to be executed.
* Parses the user's input command and returns the corresponding {@code Command} object.
* @param userCommand The full command entered by the user.
* @return The {@code Command} object representing the user's request.
* @throws AirBorderException If the user enters an unrecognized command.
public static Command parse(String userCommand) throws AirBorderException {
* The {@code TaskList} class manages a list of tasks and provides methods
* to manipulate the tasks, such as adding, deleting, and searching.
* Creates a {@code TaskList} with an existing list of tasks.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to initialize the {@code TaskList} with.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task The {@code Task} to be added.
* Deletes a task from the task list by its index.
* @param index The index of the task to delete (0-based).
* @throws AirBorderException If the index is out of bounds.
public Task deleteTask(int index) throws AirBorderException {
* Retrieves a task from the task list by its index.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve (0-based).
* @return The {@code Task} at the specified index.
* @throws AirBorderException If the index is out of bounds.
public Task getTask(int index) throws AirBorderException {
* Retrieves all tasks in the task list.
* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* Checks if the task list is empty.
* @return {@code true} if the task list is empty; {@code false} otherwise.
* Searches for tasks that contain the specified keyword in their descriptions.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* @return An {@code ArrayList} of tasks that match the keyword.
* The {@code Ui} class handles interactions with the user,
* including displaying messages and reading user input.
* Initializes the {@code Ui} with a new {@code Scanner} for user input.
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println(" Ready to assist you with your tasks!");
* Displays the exit message to the user.
System.out.println(" Thank you for flying with AirBorder!");
* Reads and returns the user's input command.
* @return The command entered by the user.
* Displays a divider line for better readability.
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param message The error message to display.
* Displays a message when a task is added.
* @param task      The task that was added.
* @param taskCount The current number of tasks.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println(" Now you have " + taskCount + " tasks.");
* Displays a message when a task is deleted.
* @param task      The task that was deleted.
* @param taskCount The current number of tasks.
public void showTaskDeleted(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println(" Now you have " + taskCount + " tasks.");
* Displays a message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
* Displays a message when a task is marked as not done.
* @param task The task that was marked as not done.
System.out.println(" Task marked as incomplete: " + task);
* Displays the list of all tasks to the user.
* @param taskList The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
System.out.println(" No tasks in your list.");
* Displays an error message if tasks cannot be loaded from the file.
System.out.println(" Error loading tasks from file.");
* Displays the tasks that match the search keyword.
* @param matchingTasks The list of tasks that match the keyword.
System.out.println(" Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
